KPK Menahan Tersangka Suap Proyek Pembangunan Jalan di Bengkalis
01 Nov 2019, 11:23 by Chairul Umam


KPK Menahan Tersangka Suap Proyek Pembangunan Jalan di Bengkalis

KBRN, Jakarta : Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi menahan Direktur PT Mitra Bungo Abadi, Makmur alias Aan, tersangka dugaan suap proyek pembangunan jalan di Bengkalis, Riau. Makmur ditahan selama 20 hari pertama.
"KPK telah melakukan penahanan selama 20 hari pertama terhadap tersangka MK (Makmur alias Aan)," kata Humas KPK Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan, Jumat (01/11/2019).
Masa penahanan terhitung sejak 31 Oktober 2019. Makmur ditahan di Rutam Klas I Jakarta Timur cabang Rutan KPK (K4).Dalam kasus ini, Makmur alias Aan ditetapkan sebagai tersangka dugaan korupsi proyek peningkatan jalan Batu Panjang-Pangkalan Nyirih, Bengkalis. Makmur diduga melakukan perbuatan itu bersama M Nasir (eks Kadis PU Bengkalis) dan Hobby Siregar (Pengusaha) yang lebih dulu menjadi tersangka dalam kasus ini.
Selain itu, KPK juga menetapkan Bupati Bengkalis nonaktif Amril Mukminin sebagai tersangka kasus dugaan suap terkait proyek pembangunan jalan Duri-Sei Pakning di Kabupaten Bengkalis. Amril diduga menerima suap Rp 5,6 miliar.
Sebelumnya, KPK telah memproses dua orang sebagai tersangka dan mendakwa ke persidangan di Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi Pekanbaru, yaitu Sekretaris Daerah Kota Dumai nonaktif dan Kepala Dinas PU Kabupaten Bengkalis 2013â€”2015 M. Nasir dan Direktur Utama PT Mawatindo Road Construction Hobby Siregar.Tersangka Makmur diduga bersama-sama dengan M. Nasir dan Hobby Siregar dan kawan-kawan melakukan tindak pidana korupsi dalam proyek peningkatan Jalan Batu Panjang-Pangkalan Nyirih di Kabupaten Bengkalis, Provinsi Riau.Diduga kerugian keuangan negara dalam proyek ini sebesar Rp105,88 miliar. Tersangka Makmur diduga diperkaya Rp60,5 miliar.

KPK Detains Bribe Suspect Road Construction Project in Bengkalis
Nov 01 2019, 11:23 by Chairul Umam


KPK Detains Bribe Suspect Road Construction Project in Bengkalis

KBRN, Jakarta: The Corruption Eradication Commission has arrested the Director of PT Mitra Bungo Abadi, Makmur alias Aan, a suspect in the bribery of a road construction project in Bengkalis, Riau. Makmur was detained for the first 20 days.
"The KPK has detained for the first 20 days the suspect MK (Makmur alias Aan)," KPK PR spokesman Febri Diansyah told reporters on Friday (01/11/2019).
The detention period is from October 31, 2019. Makmur was detained in the Rutam Klas I East Jakarta branch of the KPK Detention Center (K4). In this case, Makmur alias Aan was named as a suspect in a suspected corruption in the Batu Panjang-Pangkalan Nyirih road improvement project, Bengkalis. Makmur allegedly committed the act together with M Nasir (former Head of PU Bengkalis) and Hobby Siregar (Entrepreneur) who was the first suspect in this case.
In addition, the Corruption Eradication Commission also named the Bengkalis Regent inactive Amril Mukminin as a suspected bribery case related to the Duri-Sei Pakning road construction project in Bengkalis Regency. Amril is suspected of receiving a bribe of Rp 5.6 billion.
Previously, the KPK had processed two people as suspects and indicted the trial in the Pekanbaru Corruption Court, namely the Regional Secretary of Dumai City and the Head of the Bengkalis Regency Public Works Office 2013-2015 M. Nasir and Managing Director of PT Mawatindo Road Construction Hobby Siregar. allegedly together with M. Nasir and Hobby Siregar and his friends committed a criminal act of corruption in the project to improve the Batu Panjang-Pangkalan Nyirih Road in Bengkalis Regency, Riau Province. It is alleged that the state financial loss in this project amounted to Rp105.88 billion. Suspect Makmur allegedly enriched Rp60.5 billion.
